Class Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Triangle

  • public class Triangle
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Triangle()
      Define the unit triangle, with points (0,0), (0,1), and (1,1).
      Triangle(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
      Define a new triangle given the x and y coordinates seperately (stored in v1, v2 and v3) Also assign the distance between the points (aka the sides) to three instance variables.
      Triangle(Point a, Point b, Point c)
      Define a new triangle given three points (stored in v1, v2 and v3).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getArea()
      getArea works on a triangle and returns the area of the triangle based on its sides -- using Heron's Formula.
      double getPerimeter()
      getPerimeter works on a Triangle class and returns the sum of its sides -- it's perimeter.
      boolean isCloseEnough(double a, double b)
      isCloseEnough is essentially an '==' for floats.
      boolean isRight()
      isRight is a more in depth version of pycheck, checking if any combinations of sides works - using pycheck but switching the order of the parameters.
      double square(double b)
      A useful function that automatically squares an input
      java.lang.String toString()
      Print out the triangle and the location of its sides

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Triangle

        public Triangle()
        Define the unit triangle, with points (0,0), (0,1), and (1,1).

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(Point a,
        Point b,
        Point c)
        Define a new triangle given three points (stored in v1, v2 and v3). Also assign the distance between the points (aka the sides) to three instance variables. If the triangle is not a valid triangle, automatically transform it into the unit triangle (the default triangle).
        Parameters:
        a - is the first point
        b - is the second point
        c - is the third point

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(double x1,
        double y1,
        double x2,
        double y2,
        double x3,
        double y3)
        Define a new triangle given the x and y coordinates seperately (stored in v1, v2 and v3) Also assign the distance between the points (aka the sides) to three instance variables. If the triangle is not a valid triangle, automatically transform it into the unit triangle (the default triangle).
        Parameters:
        x1 - is the x coordinate of the first point
        y1 - is the y coordinate of the first point
        x2 - is the x coordinate of the second point
        y2 - is the y coordinate of the second point
        x3 - is the x coordinate of the third point
        y3 - is the y coordinate of the third point

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Print out the triangle and the location of its sides
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • square

        public double square(double b)
        A useful function that automatically squares an input
        Parameters:
        b - (base) is the number that is being squared

      • getPerimeter

        public double getPerimeter()
        getPerimeter works on a Triangle class and returns the sum of its sides -- it's perimeter.

      • getArea

        public double getArea()
        getArea works on a triangle and returns the area of the triangle based on its sides -- using Heron's Formula.

      • isCloseEnough

        public boolean isCloseEnough(double a,
                    double b)
        isCloseEnough is essentially an '==' for floats. Due to errors in binary calculation, it is necessary to have a function that detects if two floats are extremely close to each other.

      • isRight

        public boolean isRight()
        isRight is a more in depth version of pycheck, checking if any combinations of sides works - using pycheck but switching the order of the parameters.
